author: Stephen Wilmot
title: Paint Giants Prepped for Merger Endgame
text:
Let the paint wars commence.
The sale of Akzo Nobel’s specialty-chemicals business to private equity group Carlyle and Singapore’s sovereign-wealth fund, announced Tuesday, will create a pure-play coatings company potentially attractive to U.S. paint giants Sherwin-Williams and PPG Industries. Deals look likely in a consolidating industry, but betting on which deals prevail isn’t straightforward.
